text: Bought a Full Spectrum 18 x 24 machine 3-1/2 years ago at approx. $9,000. Had to replace laser 8 month later. ($600) 2-1/2 years old and Main processor and power supply failed. Called F.S. and got nothing. They had stopped making the main control board and offered NO assistance. Bought a new power supply and Main processor from Light Object and got machine back up and running. Quite different software to learn, but, now I prefer it. I CAN'T recommend F.S. for their customer service or warranty. Just had to replace an axis driver. Another $50 gone! Please do your OWN research!

text: It‚Äôs all about the time you spend sanding the hardwood...and sanding it correctly, and you my friend did NOT sand that wood correctly. You have to start the sanding process at about a 60 grit and work your way all the way to at least 320 or even finer. 60, 80, 120, 180, 220, 320...in that order. It‚Äôs a pain in the ass but if you want a hard wood like maple to look the way it‚Äôs should then that‚Äôs the way you gotta do it...otherwise leave it raw or lime wax it.
